author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two-year-old Prithika died after the food she ate choked her windpipe on Wednesday afternoon. The incident happened in a day-care centre at Navalur Pirivu.

She was rushed to a private hospital, where she was declared as brought dead. Her body was taken to the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital where a post-mortem examination was conducted.

The girl’s father Ranjith Kumar, from Pongaliyur near Vadavalli, was a lathe worker and mother Pavithra worked in a nearby mill. The parents of the girl have asked the police to initiate action against the centre alleging their carelessness as the cause of their daughter’s death. Police registered the case under 174 (unnatural death) of the Code of Criminal Procedures and were investigating.
title: Girl dies as food chokes windpipe
